TopicTitle: Pilot Percy Prune posted to KSP

Articles.Content:
Hello all. Just been transferred to KSC. The C.O. said in the posting notes that "KSP is the ideal place for this officer to develop his natural talents."

Not sure what he means but I shall miss looking at all those craters I made in the outback at Woomera...

... Meanwhile, in the real world, I have finally joined the forum after lurking for too long in order to say a big Thank You to the modders (and Squad!) who make this game such fun.

Like maceeemiller ( http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101663-Where-has-this-been-all-my-life! ), I'm an old fogey who has been messing around with computers since ZX81 days but not come across anything as hilarious as KSP before.

Hope I can add a few chuckles along the way...

Yours,

Perce.

Yours,

Perce.

Mine? aawww thanks!

Welcome aboard! Nice start to a long time spent here. you will never leave

Aaannnnyyyywwwaaayyysss have fun!

Welcome to the KSP forums,

please remember to abide by our rules and have safe flights!

B787

:-) Oldies. I still have one of* my ZX-81s.

[*Couldn't afford a pre-built one but expected to mess-up building the kit so bought two].

Welcome aboard Sir!

You can be sure to find more people your age, like me for example, as i can recall coding and playing on the ZX-81, Sinclair Spectrum and C64 as well. So... Enjoy this awesome community and Godspeed on your missions!

Frank

Thanks for the welcome!

I wrote some lousy programs for the ZX81 and tried to write a flight sim for the BBC B in BASIC, which proves that I was a) optimistic or very stupid.

I'm still optimistic...

Greatest achievement in KSP so far was taking my trusty lightweight Land Rover to the highest peak of Airstrip Isle. The car ferry journey was hair raising enough!

If I can work out how to post a pic. I will.

If I can work out how to post a pic. I will.

Do a screengrab, post the file to imgur.com or somesuch, and slap the link here.

Also, welcome!

Hi there

'Screengrab', no problem.

If I can't attach directly I will need to sign up to online host in order to 'post to...'. At the moment everything is on the hard drive sitting next to me. My head may be in the clouds but my data isn't!

The highest peak on the Island, looking back to KSP:

Trip made entirely by land and sea!

please remember to abide by our rules

In case you are wondering what those are:

1) be friendly

2) have fun

3) there is no rule 3
